title: Servo Motors and Drives Market by Type, by supply Voltage, by Components, by Application and by Geography - Global Forecast to 2020
text:
ReportBuyer
LONDON , Sept. 24, Globalization and industrialization have generated the need for high production capacity, high qualitative output, and increased supply within the limited time. This increases the demand for automation systems such as servo motors and drives, globally. These motors and drives are used in different application sectors, specifically suited for controlling the movement of machines.
Servo technology includes electric motors and drives. Servo motors are the highly developed motion control devices. They are specifically used to control the movement of machines. They integrate very specific dimensional tolerance, advanced design methods, and high-force magnet materials. The servo drives or amplifiers provide the electrical energy that produces movement in a servo motor. Servo drives work on the signals that are sent from the feedback device which are attached to the motor, and determine the servo motor's position in order to energize the motor so that the position and speed can be achieved as per the user requirement. The control signals are generated in between the motor and the controller, and then the motion controller converts these control signals into power signals for the motor.
The global servo motors & drives market was valued at USD 8.64 billion in 2014 and is projected to reach USD 12.56 billion by 2020, at a CAGR of 6.1% from 2015 to 2020. The industrial segment accounted for the largest share of ~25% of the total servo motors and drives market in 2014.
The report includes company profiles of major players, recent activities in the market, new product launches, mergers & acquisitions, collaborations and partnerships, and SWOT analysis.
Some of the major players operating in the global servo motors and drives market include Yaskawa Electric Corporation ( Japan ), Mitsubishi Electric Corporation ( Japan ), Siemens AG ( Germany ), Schneider Electric ( France ), Rockwell Automation Inc. (U.S.), ABB ltd. (U.S.), KINCO Automation Pvt. Ltd ( China ), Delta Electronics, Inc. ( Taiwan ), Emerson Electric Co. (U.S.) and Adtech ( SHENZHEN ) Technology Co. Ltd. ( Japan ). Most of the companies have adopted various strategies, such as mergers & acquisitions and partnership, among others to sustain in the servo motors and drives market.
